title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:03 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
00:05 <lucaa1> has quit  
00:18 <lucaa> has quit  
00:19 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
00:24 <lucaa> has quit  
00:31 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
01:08 <sdumitriu> has quit  
01:15 <abusenius> has quit  
01:24 <lucaa> has quit  
02:59 <npm\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
03:04 <npm\_> has quit  
03:40 <venkatna> has joined #xwiki  
03:41 <venkatna> has quit  
04:19 <Menso> has quit  
05:32 <lpereira> has joined #xwiki  
07:48 <lpereira> has quit  
08:04 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:44 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:30 <lucaa> has quit  
10:07 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <jstoldt> good morning everybody  
10:08 <vmassol> jstoldt: good morning  
10:09 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:11 <vmassol> today is 2.7 final release (normally)  
10:14 <lucaa> has quit  
10:17 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <jstoldt> context macro looks neat  
10:17 <vmassol> jstoldt: I had a need for it on some use case for xwiki.org...  
10:18 <jstoldt> nice addition to work with lightbox images  
10:18 <jstoldt> now i had to make relative links pointing to the picture download  
10:18 <jstoldt> which is also rather clumsy  
10:18 <jstoldt> besides, are there plans to introduce lightbox capability to the image syntax for 2.1? because that would really come in handy!  
10:19 <vmassol> jstoldt: not in the syntax but as macro yes  
10:19 <vmassol> when I say "yes" I mean we all want a lightbox macro  
10:19 <vmassol> now someone has to code it  
10:19 <vmassol> :)  
10:20 <jstoldt> well there is one, isn't there?  
10:20 <vmassol> there are some on extensions but not using java macros  
10:20 <jstoldt> it works rather nice till the point you try to use pictures from other pages or use include  
10:20 <vmassol> actually there's one you're right  
10:20 <jstoldt> yep  
10:20 <vmassol> I thought it was an oldish plugin  
10:21 <jstoldt> yeah, that was the previous version  
10:21 <vmassol> it's not part of the platform distribution though  
10:21 <jstoldt> the latest macro is kinda standalone wiki plugin-ish ;)  
10:21 <jstoldt> exactly  
10:21 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: tmortagne broke the ldap implementation  
10:22 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ouch  
10:22 <@sdumitriu> As soon as he fixes that I'll start the release  
10:22 <jstoldt> that's why i asked about adding that capability to the images syntax. that would enable the user to pick an image via the WYSIWYG editor  
10:22 <jstoldt> sdumitriu: what release? 2.7 RC2?  
10:22 <jstoldt> because i was just about to update to RC1...  
10:23 <vmassol> jstoldt: we want to add the ability to have custom wysiwyg editors for macros  
10:23 <vmassol> (in the not too far future)  
10:23 <jstoldt> yeah, i think i kinda participated in that discussion last week and it sounds very nice, indeed  
10:24 <vmassol> disconnecting for 2 minutes, brb  
10:24 <vmassol> has quit  
10:28 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <jstoldt> btw, i noticed strings for container, dashboard, Spaces and Tag Cloud macro are not being localized right now.  
10:29 <vmassol> jstoldt: what string?  
10:29 <vmassol> for container macro for ex, wdym?  
10:29 <vmassol> you mean the parameter name?  
10:29 <jstoldt> the strings displayed in the macro interface of the wysiwyg editor  
10:29 <vmassol> oh I see  
10:30 <vmassol> hmm i thought this was automatic  
10:30 <vmassol> mflorea: ?  
10:31 <vmassol> sdumitriu: just checked and thomas is on holiday from today included till the 28th....  
10:32 <+mflorea> vmassol, jstoldt: they are localized, but if they were not translated in the language you use then the English values are displayed  
10:32 <jstoldt> well, i translated everything that is to be translated into german  
10:32 <jstoldt> so either l10n.xwiki.org is not showing me everything  
10:32 <jstoldt> or something is bugged  
10:33 <+mflorea> jstoldt: what XE version are you using? (so that I can check the translation file for that version)  
10:33 <jstoldt> 2.6 final right now  
10:34 <+mflorea> ok, let me check  
10:34 <jstoldt> sure  
10:34 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I can send an SMS to thomas. Just want to be sure about what he broke and whether we can fix it without him or not  
10:34 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <vmassol> oops, hadn't planned this one :)  
10:38 <jstoldt> what would be the proper function to retrieve the download link to an attached file on page a if the picture is attached to page b, when the name of the file is specified like this: [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)?  
10:41 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I changed a class field name  
10:41 <vmassol> from "Lead" to "lead"  
10:41 <vmassol> and all the object field content seems to have been lost  
10:42 <vmassol> for ex check: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/New+Rendering+Architecture?viewer=changes  
10:42 <@sdumitriu> There's an open issue for that  
10:43 <@sdumitriu> It's only on mysql  
10:43 <vmassol> ouch….. so what are my options now?  
10:44 <vmassol> (it's quite an important bug btw)  
10:44 <@sdumitriu> Revert  
10:44 <+mflorea> jstoldt: the container macro isn't localized. Its translation keys were not added to ApplicationResources.properties file in xwiki-core so l10n.xwiki.org doesn't display them. You should open a JIRA issue for this and link it to http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5544 (you can also assign it to Anca Luca)  
10:44 <vmassol> so scripting a revert?  
10:44 <@sdumitriu> Is tmortagne available today?  
10:45 <vmassol> sdumitriu: see above  
10:45 <vmassol> I pinged you about it  
10:45 <@sdumitriu> Ah  
10:45 <jstoldt> mflorea: will do. should i only do this for Container and Dashboard or should i add Spaces and Tag Cloud in the same ticket?  
10:45 <@sdumitriu> K, someone else should fix it  
10:46 <@sdumitriu> The tests are a good pointer  
10:46 <vmassol> grr… so now I need to spend 1 hour to fix my class change….  
10:47 <vmassol> so I need to find the last but one rev for each doc and then run the rollback action  
10:48 <vmassol> we don't seem to have any rollback api  
10:50 <camaritei> has joined #xwiki  
10:50 <+mflorea> jstoldt: Indeed, neither spaces macro nor tab cloud macro are localized. I think you can open just one issue saying that "Dashboard macros aren't localized" and list all macros in the description. Anca will fix it.  
10:50 <jstoldt> cool  
10:51 <vmassol> jstoldt, mflorea: I guess I need to add keys for the context macro too ;)  
10:51 <vmassol> I'll check how to do this  
10:51 <jstoldt> yes indeed ;)  
10:51 <vmassol> mflorea: do we have a solution for keys to be in the macro module rather than in some external location?  
10:52 <vmassol> (probably not possible yet)  
10:52 <jstoldt> XWIKI-5817  
10:52 <jstoldt> dunno how to assign this  
10:53 <+mflorea> vmassol: note that I added the keys for the initial Java macros, but now, whenever someone add a macro he needs to add the translation keys to ApplicationResources.properties file.  
10:54 <+mflorea> vmassol: I don't know. The keys have to be in ApplicationResources.properties file so that l10n.xwiki.org sees them. The problem right now is that the English translation is duplicated: once in the Java file as annotations and once in the ApplicationResources.properties file  
10:55 <+mflorea> what we can do if to write some code to automatically update ApplicationResources.properties file whenever a new Java macro is added  
10:56 <vmassol> mflorea: I think it's this issue: ?  
10:56 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-2888  
11:03 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <jstoldt> where can i find the documentation for functions available via velocity?  
11:05 <jstoldt> on a wiki page  
11:06 <+mflorea> jstoldt: look for velocity tools and xwiki javadoc on google  
11:06 <vmassol> mflorea: it's not clear if we need the descriptions to start with an upercase or not  
11:06 <jstoldt> thx  
11:06 <vmassol> there's a bit of everything  
11:07 <vmassol> my take is that it should always be uppercase for all macro keys  
11:07 <vmassol> is that correect?  
11:07 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:07 <+mflorea> you're referring to the key value right?  
11:07 <vmassol> yes  
11:08 <+mflorea> the WYSIWYG editor displayed them using CSS text-transform:capitalize so it doesn't matter, but since the keys are not only for the editor I think too that they should start with upper case  
11:09 <vmassol> mflorea: and no ending dot right?  
11:09 <vmassol> hmm actually the dot should probbaly be added since it can depend on the language I guess  
11:10 <vmassol> actually depends how it's printed  
11:10 <vmassol> I don't know  
11:10 <vmassol> wdyt?  
11:10 <+mflorea> hmm, yes, I usually put the dot when I have a phrase, but maybe that's how it is in Romanian  
11:11 <jstoldt> imo the descriptors should be a complete sentence  
11:11 <+mflorea> technically the dot is a separator and if there is nothing to separate then the doc it useless  
11:11 <+mflorea> s/doc/dot  
11:12 <jstoldt> technically yes but not putting anything is a little like ending any sentence with... to me  
11:12 <vmassol> this needs a mail on the list  
11:13 <jstoldt> :)  
11:13 <vmassol> and then documenting it on dev.xwiki.org  
11:13 <vmassol> as a best practice + on l10n  
11:13 <+mflorea> yes, indeed, and checkstyle asks for a dot at the end of the javadoc description.  
11:13 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:13 <vmassol> mflorea: no  
11:13 <vmassol> not for params  
11:13 <+mflorea> yes, only for the description  
11:14 <+sburjan> hello everyone :)  
11:14 <vmassol> jstoldt: want to lead this?  
11:14 <vmassol> (the mail proposal)  
11:15 <jstoldt> ah no, i'd rather not because i really am not into the whole maillist thingy... i just can't get myself to start bothering with this kind of thing ;)  
11:15 <jstoldt> i'm the bulletin board and IM kind of person ;)  
11:15 <vmassol> jstoldt: well mailing list == forum  
11:16 <vmassol> so just use nabble  
11:16 <vmassol> here: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Forum  
11:17 <jstoldt> well, sure, but i'd rather not. i'll happily brainstorm with you but i don't know what should be content of such a proposal and best practice and whatnot... really ;)  
11:17 <vmassol> ok too bad thought it was a chance you could help on this  
11:18 <vmassol> nothing will happen then  
11:18 <jstoldt> wow, you know how to make people do your bidding! ;)  
11:18 <jstoldt> okay, will do it before i'll be responsible for pending doom  
11:18 <vmassol> :)  
11:20 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:21 <jstoldt> but in exchange i'd like to know how to retrieve the another doc in a given space because apparently getDoc will only retrieve current  
11:21 <jstoldt> ah, get document  
11:21 <vmassol> $xwiki.getDocument(...)  
11:21 <jstoldt> that was blackmail unwisely spent :-D  
11:21 <vmassol> hehe  
11:21 <vmassol> too late, it was spent!  
11:21 <jstoldt> yeah...  
11:22 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: I found a fix for the opacity issue in lightboxIE.css .. I had to write different rules for IE6/7/8.. wonderful, you're see. We might need a velocity macro (too bad there are no CSS macros) so that the opacity is set using valid CSS elsewhere.  
11:23 <+sburjan> vmassol: Yishay Mor replied to my email. He attached a text file with the macro ..  
11:23 <vmassol> k  
11:23 <+sburjan> should I forward it to you ? I'm not 100% confident I'll be able to put the content properly  
11:25 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: any fixed date for 2.7 final ?  
11:25 <+sburjan> I never find the good mail  
11:25 <@sdumitriu> Today  
11:25 <+sburjan> ohhhhh  
11:26 <+sburjan> so I'd better start testing  
11:26 <@sdumitriu> Where's sabageru?  
11:26 <+sburjan> je ne sais pas  
11:27 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: is there an issue opened for the opacity issue?  
11:27 <vmassol> sdumitriu: you could send a mail about the LDAP issue on the list and thomas will probably see it if he checks his emails  
11:27 <@sdumitriu> mflorea:  No  
11:28 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: thanks, I'll open one  
11:28 <vmassol> still trying to figure out how to perform a revert programmatically…. anyone has a code snippet for that?  
11:29 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: I see we have no new build since 18 dec. Is there something I am missing ?  
11:29 <vmassol> oh we do have an api:     public XWikiDocument rollback(final XWikiDocument tdoc, String rev, XWikiContext context) throws XWikiException  
11:29 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: No commits to trigger the build?  
11:29 <vmassol> now need to find out how to get the rev  
11:29 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: CriteriaService  
11:29 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: okay.. than wdyt .. should I wait for the final version test again the latest snapshot ?  
11:30 <@sdumitriu> There are only two commits planned  
11:30 <@sdumitriu> mflorea's fix for the IE7 lightbox opacity  
11:30 <@sdumitriu> And fixing the LDAP  
11:30 <+sburjan> and the As thing I guess  
11:30 <+sburjan> ah  
11:30 <+mflorea> yep, committing right now  
11:30 <+sburjan> the As was fixed ?  
11:31 <@sdumitriu> So you can test the existing snapshot, and then retest the IE7 issue on the next build  
11:31 <+sburjan> ok  
11:31 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: I think that one is fixed  
11:31 <cjdelisle> Good morning, I'm trying to figure out how to store metadata from old versions of attachments. Does anyone have a preference on how that should be done?  
11:31 <@sdumitriu> You must test it  
11:31 <+sburjan> please ping me when the build with the IE fix is done  
11:31 <jstoldt> mflorea: are you currently working on the lightbox macro available on extensions.xwiki.org or are you creating a new one for 3.0 all togther? because i was thinking of improving the one on extensions  
11:32 <cjdelisle> Something like storing each version in an XML element perhaps?  
11:32 <@sdumitriu> jstoldt: He's not working an any  
11:32 <cjdelisle> If we are going to continue using JRCS then it needs to be fixed. It's a ram pig.  
11:32 <@sdumitriu> s/an/on  
11:32 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I don't see how CriteriaService can help me say: "last but one" rev  
11:32 <+mflorea> jstoldt: no, I'm just fixing the CSS for the lightbox that is bundled in XWiki platform  
11:32 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Select last 2, then pick the first  
11:33 <jstoldt> there is a css for lightbox on xwiki available? how does that work?  
11:33 <@sdumitriu> jstoldt: It's a different lightbox  
11:33 <jstoldt> oh ok  
11:33 <@sdumitriu> There are 3 things called lightbox right now  
11:33 <@sdumitriu> Two are in the platform, one is on the extensions wiki  
11:34 <jstoldt> and what are those in the platform for?  
11:34 <@sdumitriu> One is the modal box which is used for confirmations and the JumpToPage feature  
11:34 <@sdumitriu> One is the lightbox that is used in the administration for creating/editing groups and users  
11:35 <@sdumitriu> The latter one is deprecated  
11:35 <@sdumitriu> And buggy  
11:35 <jstoldt> ah, that makes sense then, although it's a little confusing ;)  
11:35 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:35 <jstoldt> thanks for the elaboration  
11:35 <cjdelisle> "<sdumitriu> The latter one is deprecated" documented?  
11:35 <sabageru> has joined #xwiki  
11:35 <@sdumitriu> No  
11:36 <cjdelisle> Was it decided on the list to deprecate it? ;)  
11:36 <@sdumitriu> No  
11:36 <@sdumitriu> Actually I might be the only one who knows it's deprecated  
11:36 <cjdelisle> Sorry for being a pain, I just don't like all this deprecatedish stuff.  
11:37 <cjdelisle> lol  
11:37 <@sdumitriu> It's just that it is such bad code  
11:37 <@sdumitriu> And bad code is always deprecated, right?  
11:37 <+sburjan> :)  
11:37 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: By version metadata what do you mean?  
11:37 <cjdelisle> Meta data from every version except the newest.  
11:38 <@sdumitriu> Author, version, size only?  
11:38 <@sdumitriu> Or also the content?  
11:38 <cjdelisle> Everything except the content.  
11:38 <vmassol> sdumitriu: trying to understand what you mean. Right now I only see RevisionCriteria used in List<String> getRevisions(RevisionCriteria criteria). Is that what you mean?  
11:38 <cjdelisle> We agreed that the content should be a seperate file IIRC.  
11:38 <jstoldt> vmassol: I did thy bidding. Thou shalt receive message from the list of messages of evolutionairy advancement, soon.  
11:39 <abusenius> has quit  
11:39 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Yes  
11:39 <vmassol> jstoldt: Ic þ? þancas d?  
11:39 <jstoldt> okay, i don't get that! X-D  
11:39 <@sdumitriu> There's a CriteriaFactory which lets you specify order, range, minor versions  
11:39 <+sburjan> mflorea: the problem with Oo Server doesn't reproduce on my PC. So i guess it's all good. What functionality could be broken because of this fix.. where should I focus more ?  
11:40 <vmassol> (ok maybe too old… it's old english for "thank you" ;))  
11:40 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: If OO starts well, then it works  
11:40 <jstoldt> lol, seems like celtic to me...  
11:40 <vmassol> yeah probably too old english  
11:40 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: didn't we removed some package ? or we just patched one of the JAR's  
11:41 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: I think JRCS in the API is bad anyway  
11:41 <cjdelisle> +1  
11:41 <@sdumitriu> So you can store whatever you want  
11:41 <+mflorea> sburjan: yes, as sdumitriu says, if oo server starts then everything is fine. REST is not affected because we're using its JSON library  
11:41 <+sburjan> mflorea sdumitriu  : great :D  
11:42 <cjdelisle> Well this will have some importance because people will have this persisted on their hard disk and need to upgrade.  
11:42 <vmassol> sdumitriu: RevisionCriteriaFactory doesn't seemt o support ranges right now… anyway will find a way  
11:42 <cjdelisle> If noone stops me, I'm going to write an xml diff library ;)  
11:42 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Why write? There are tons available  
11:42 <vmassol> cjdelisle:have you done a quick check for exsiting ones?  
11:43 <cjdelisle> I found one which was GPL, I can keep looking though.  
11:43 <@sdumitriu> http://maven.xwiki.org/externals/fr/loria/ecoo/JLibDiff/  
11:44 <vmassol> we need one that is active preferably  
11:44 <cjdelisle> I really don't like the mixing of xml and non xml diff.  
11:44 <vmassol> found this too: http://code.google.com/p/fc-xmldiff/  
11:44 <@sdumitriu> There isn't much to be active about  
11:44 <vmassol> but activity is low  
11:44 <vmassol> there's always a need  
11:44 <vmassol> check jrcs  
11:45 <@sdumitriu> JRCS is big  
11:45 <jvdrean> has quit  
11:45 <cjdelisle> memory used by jrcs is HUGE  
11:45 <vmassol> "The Fuego Core XML Diff and Patch tool is a fast and memory-efficient general-purpose tool for diffing and patching XML files"  
11:45 <vmassol> I'm sure you'll like that ;)  
11:46 <cjdelisle> Sounds like what I'm looking for. All XML (so xerces could read the diff file) and not schlamile the painter on memory.  
11:46 <vmassol> 0.1.0 doesn't seem very tempting though  
11:47 <vmassol> sdumitriu: you see there's always a need for activity: http://code.google.com/p/fc-xmldiff/updates/list  
11:47 <vmassol> "fc-xmldiff produces invalid xml file) reported by http://code.google.com/u/corzani/"  
11:47 <cjdelisle> Depends on how long it's existed. Slow release cycles indicate attention to detail.  
11:47 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
11:47 <cjdelisle> Or I should say fast release cycles but incrementing the number only a little bit each time.  
11:48 <cjdelisle> Shows they want to be sure and get it right IMO.  
11:48 <vmassol> last change was Jun 26, 2009  
11:48 <vmassol> and the project was also created on that same date  
11:48 <cjdelisle> That's a little slow I agree.  
11:49 <cjdelisle> s/little/lot/  
11:50 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: I have a small UI-issue. This is not new. When editing the page in wiki mode, the autosave feature with it's corresponding text : every  minutes . The text is almost invisible  
11:52 <mflorea> has quit  
12:01 <mihaipaun> has joined #xwiki  
12:02 <Menso> has joined #xwiki  
12:05 <cjdelisle> http://sourceforge.net/projects/diffxml/ best one I can find, it's patches are valid xml, it looks well thought out, there are papers on the algorithm, but GPL.  
12:09 <vmassol> sdumitriu: does this sound good: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Rollback+A+Document ?  
12:10 <cjdelisle> I think the best thing to do is for now, make an xml document and put each revision under a node without any diffing at all.  
12:11 <cjdelisle> But the root node will have serializer="nameOfTheSerializer"  
12:11 <cjdelisle> So in the future we can improve the serializer and have backward compatibility  
12:11 <vmassol> sdumitriu: when i rollback the DesignClass, is it going to make modifications to all docs having it as objects?  
12:14 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: The snippet looks good  
12:14 <@sdumitriu> Changing the class: I don't know, but either way, you'll still hit the same bug  
12:15 <@sdumitriu> So you won't get your data back  
12:15 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: That'd  
12:15 <vmassol> sure  
12:15 <vmassol> ok trying
